intro: Aristea bequaertii, commonly known as the Bequaert's aristea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, tubular flowers arranged in a dense cluster, often with a yellow or orange center and white or pale blue petals. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
